label: 159.  Letter to St. Peter's Church -- November 1, 1851
description: Printed letter from William H. W. Barnwell to his congregation at St. Peter's Church, Charleston, thanking them for their contribution to the China mission of Bishop William Boone. November 1, 1851.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: William H. Barnwell Nov 1st, 1851To the Congregation of St. Peter's Church CHARLESTON    My Dear Friends—  On Thanksgiving Day, the sexton placed into  my hands an envelope containing one hundred and fifteen  dollars, with the following superscription :  "From St. Peter's Congregation—A Thank-Offering to  our Heavenly Parent, for His goodness in restoring to us the  much valued services of our beloved Pastor. Towards the  China or Boone Mission, if it meets with his approbation.  Thursday morning."  Accept my sincere thanks, in the name of Bishop Boone,  towards whose support this Offering is appropriated, for the  gift itself, and for the manner in which it is conveyed. May  God reward you a hundred fold by the unspeakable gift of  His Holy Spirit.  Your friend and Pastor,  WM. H. BARNWELL.  St. Peter's Vestry Room  Nov. 1st, 1851.
